name: Scrapdiver Serpent
text: Scrapdiver Serpent can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an artifact.

editions.flavor: Smart artificers clean up after themselves.

name: Scrapheap
text: Whenever an artifact or enchantment is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: Junk heaps have rats, but scrapheaps have goblins.

name: Scrapheap Scrounger
text:
Scrapheap Scrounger can't block.
{1}{B}, Exile another creature card from your graveyard: Return Scrapheap Scrounger from your graveyard to the battlefield.

editions.flavor: Some machines refuse to accept their own obsolescence.

name: Scrap Mastery
text: Each player exiles all artifact cards from his or her graveyard, then sacrifices all artifacts he or she controls, then puts all cards he or she exiled this way onto the battlefield.

editions.flavor: "Where a lesser mind sees junk, I see infinite potential."

name: Scrapper Champion
text:
Double strike (This creature deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
When Scrapper Champion enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Scrapper Champion attacks, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

name: Scrapskin Drake
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Scrapskin Drake can block only creatures with flying.

editions.flavor:
"The cathars killed my skaabs down below. Let's see how high their swords can reach."
—Ludevic, necro-alchemist

"The cathars killed my skaabs down below. Let's see how high their swords can reach."
—Ludevic, necro-alchemist
"The cathars killed my skaabs down below. Let's see how high their swords can reach."—Ludevic, necro-alchemist

name: Scrap Trawler
text: Whenever Scrap Trawler or another artifact you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return to your hand target artifact card in your graveyard with lesser converted mana cost.

name: Scrapyard Mongrel
text: As long as you control an artifact, Scrapyard Mongrel gets +2/+0 and has trample. (If it would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

editions.flavor: Trespassers are welcome to try.

name: Scrapyard Salvo
text: Scrapyard Salvo deals damage to target player equal to the number of artifact cards in your graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"Squealstokers! Build me a glorious pile of Mirran metal. Then add yourselves to the pile."
—Furnace boss, sector 11

name: Screaming Fury
text: Target creature gets +5/+0 and gains haste until end of turn.

editions.flavor: He's got an axe to grind.

name: Screaming Seahawk
text:
Flying
When Screaming Seahawk enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a card named Screaming Seahawk, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

name: Screamreach Brawler
text: Dash {1}{R} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

editions.flavor: "My dragonlord's lightning will dance upon your bones!"

name: Screams from Within
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1.
When enchanted creature dies, return Screams from Within from your graveyard to the battlefield.

editions.flavor: There's no escaping an enemy that lives inside your head.

name: Screams of the Damned
text: {1}{B}, Exile a card from your graveyard: Screams of the Damned deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

editions.flavor: It's important to face your inner demons . . . unless they're the kind of demons that can kill you.

name: Screeching Bat
text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {2}{B}{B}. If you do, transform Screeching Bat.

editions.flavor: The bat has such clarity of hearing that simple sounds become symphonies.

name: Screeching Buzzard
text:
Flying
When Screeching Buzzard dies, each opponent discards a card.

name: Screeching Drake
text:
Flying
When Screeching Drake enters the battlefield, draw a card, then discard a card.

name: Screeching Griffin
text:
Flying
{R}: Target creature can't block Screeching Griffin this turn.

editions.flavor: They were master fishers, but their seas are now the streets and their catch, the goblins that run pell-mell from the screeching in the sky.

name: Screeching Harpy
text:
Flying
{1}{B}: Regenerate Screeching Harpy.

editions.flavor:
"They are called ‘fowl' for a reason."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight

"They are called ‘fowl' for a reason."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight

name: Screeching Silcaw
text:
Flying
Metalcraft — Whenever Screeching Silcaw deals combat damage to a player, if you control three or more artifacts, that player puts the top four cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor: It's adaptively deaf to its own cries.

name: Screeching Skaab
text: When Screeching Skaab enters the battlefield, put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.

editions.flavor: Its screeching is the sound of you losing your mind.
Its screeching is the sound of you losing your mind.
Its screeching is the sound of you losing your mind.
Its screeching is the sound of you losing your mind.

name: Screeching Sliver
text: All Slivers have "{T}: Target player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard."

editions.flavor:
"What wears down my people most, I think, is not the danger, but the endless screeching outside our camp."
—Merrik Aidar, Benalish patrol

name: Scrib Nibblers
text:
{T}: Exile the top card of target player's library. If it's a land card, you gain 1 life.
Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you may untap Scrib Nibblers.

name: Scrivener
text: When Scrivener enters the battlefield, you may return target instant card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: A good memory is no match for a good scribe.

"History is a potent weapon."
—Karn, silver golem
A good memory is no match for a good scribe.

"History is a potent weapon."
—Karn, silver golem

name: Scroll of Avacyn
text: {1}, Sacrifice Scroll of Avacyn: Draw a card. If you control an Angel, you gain 5 life.

editions.flavor: Words to bless the eye that reads them, telling of a future beyond the reach of fear.

name: Scroll of Griselbrand
text: {1}, Sacrifice Scroll of Griselbrand: Target opponent discards a card. If you control a Demon, that player loses 3 life.

editions.flavor: Words no eyes should see, telling of things no sane mind could fathom.

name: Scroll of Origins
text: {2}, {T}: Draw a card if you have seven or more cards in hand.

editions.flavor: The words from which language sprang, the knowledge from which thought was born, the story from which history was woven.

name: Scroll of the Masters
text:
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, put a lore counter on Scroll of the Masters.
{3}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each lore counter on Scroll of the Masters.

name: Scroll Rack
text: {1}, {T}: Exile any number of cards from your hand face down. Put that many cards from the top of your library into your hand. Then look at the exiled cards and put them on top of your library in any order.

name: Scroll Thief
text: Whenever Scroll Thief deals combat damage to a player, draw a card.

editions.flavor: Kapsho merfolk have infiltrated fortresses as remote as the desert citadel in Sunari in their relentless quest for arcane knowledge.
I've learned how to disable wards, pick locks, and decode the Agaran language—all before even reading the scroll!
The arcane academies along the coast were powerless to protect themselves from the brazen raiders of the Kapsho Seas.
I've learned how to disable wards, pick locks, and decode the Agaran language—all before even reading the scroll!

name: Scrounge
text: Target opponent chooses an artifact card in his or her graveyard. Put that card onto the battlefield under your control.

editions.flavor: When leonin settlers abandon their homes to the nim, items of value are often left behind.

name: Scrounged Scythe
Scrounging Bandar
text:
Scrounging Bandar enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may move any number of +1/+1 counters from Scrounging Bandar onto another target creature.

editions.flavor: "It was right here a second ago . . ."

name: Scrubland
text: ({T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool.)

name: Scryb Ranger
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying, protection from blue
Return a Forest you control to its owner's hand: Untap target creature. Activate this ability only once each turn.

name: Scryb Sprites
text: Flying

editions.flavor: The only sound was the gentle clicking of the Faeries' wings. Then those intruders who were still standing turned and fled. One thing was certain: they didn't think the Scryb were very funny anymore.

name: Scrying Glass
text: {3}, {T}: Choose a number greater than 0 and a color. Target opponent reveals his or her hand. If that opponent reveals exactly the chosen number of cards of the chosen color, you draw a card.

name: Scrying Sheets
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{1}{S}, {T}: Look at the top card of your library. If that card is snow, you may reveal it and put it into your hand. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)

name: Sculpting Steel
text: You may have Sculpting Steel enter the battlefield as a copy of any artifact on the battlefield.

editions.flavor: Perfected by the kinetic sculptor Shanti Makam, these self-assembling metal strands can be coaxed into any shape imaginable.
An artificer once dropped one in a vault full of coins. She has yet to find it.
An artificer once dropped one in a vault full of coins. She has yet to find it.

name: Scute Mob
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control five or more lands, put four +1/+1 counters on Scute Mob.

editions.flavor:
"Survival rule 781: There are always more scute bugs."
—Zurdi, goblin shortcutter

"Survival rule 781: There are always more scute bugs."
—Zurdi, goblin shortcutter

"Survival rule 781: There are always more scute bugs."
—Zurdi, goblin shortcutter

name: Scuttlemutt
text:
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
{T}: Target creature becomes the color or colors of your choice until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Built to shuttle goods from the river, it took off one day carrying a cauldron of dyes.

name: Scuttling Death
text:
Sacrifice Scuttling Death: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Soulshift 4 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 4 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

name: Scuttling Doom Engine
text:
Scuttling Doom Engine can't be blocked by creatures with power 2 or less.
When Scuttling Doom Engine dies, it deals 6 damage to target opponent.

editions.flavor: A masterwork of spite, inspired by madness.

name: Scuzzback Marauders
text:
Trample
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

name: Scuzzback Scrapper
text: Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)

editions.flavor: The Scuzzback gang scavenges rusty armor covered in barbed protrusions. No threat is more effective than the threat of infection.

name: Scytheclaw
text:
Living weapon (When this Equipment enters the battlefield, create a 0/0 black Germ creature token, then attach this to it.)
Equipped creature gets +1/+1.
Whenever equipped creature deals combat damage to a player, that player loses half his or her life, rounded up.
Equip {3}

name: Scythe Leopard
text: Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, Scythe Leopard gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
editions.flavor: Eldrazi are not the leopard's preferred prey, but they are better than no prey at all.
Eldrazi are not the leopard's preferred prey, but they are better than no prey at all.
Eldrazi are not the leopard's preferred prey, but they are better than no prey at all.

name: Scythe of the Wretched
Scythe Specter
text:
Flying
Whenever Scythe Specter deals combat damage to a player, each opponent discards a card. Each player who discarded a card with the highest converted mana cost among cards discarded this way loses life equal to that converted mana cost.

name: Scythe Tiger
text:
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
When Scythe Tiger enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice a land.

editions.flavor: Instead of adapting to its environment, it adapts its environment to itself.

name: Seachrome Coast
text:
Seachrome Coast enters the battlefield tapped unless you control two or fewer other lands.
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Where the Quicksilver Sea laps over the Razor Fields, the landscape reflects the suns' fading hope.

name: Seacoast Drake
text: Flying

editions.flavor: Seacoast drakes have been known to follow ships for hundreds of miles, waiting to snap up garbage, bait, and the occasional sailor.

name: Sea Drake
text:
Flying
When Sea Drake enters the battlefield, return two target lands you control to their owner's hand.

name: Sea Eagle
text: Flying

editions.flavor: Where air meets water, fish meets talon.
Where air meets water, fish meets talon.
Where air meets water, fish meets talon.

name: Seafarer's Quay
text: Blue legendary creatures you control have "bands with other legendary creatures." (Any legendary creatures can attack in a band as long as at least one has "bands with other legendary creatures." Bands are blocked as a group. If at least two legendary creatures you control, one of which has "bands with other legendary creatures," are blocking or being blocked by the same creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

name: Seafloor Debris
text:
Seafloor Debris enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Seafloor Debris: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

name: Sea Gate Loremaster
text: {T}: Draw a card for each Ally you control.

editions.flavor:
"He's a living library. He remembers everything our band of explorers has seen, and we can use that to our advantage."
—Zahr Gada, Halimar expedition leader

name: Sea Gate Oracle
text: When Sea Gate Oracle enters the battlefield, look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other on the bottom of your library.

editions.flavor: "The secret entrance should be near."
"The secret entrance should be near."
"The secret entrance should be near."

name: Sea Gate Wreckage
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool. ({C} represents colorless mana.)
{2}{C}, {T}: Draw a card. Activate this ability only if you have no cards in hand.

editions.flavor: Once a center for knowledge, Sea Gate now serves as a reminder of what was lost.

name: Sea God's Revenge
text: Return up to three target creatures your opponents control to their owners' hands. Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

editions.flavor:
"What has neither mouth nor throat, yet swallows captain, crew, and boat?"
—Sphinx's riddle

"Your recent work is an inspiration. I have the utmost respect for your approach, and your craft is impeccable. At your convenience, I would be honored to collaborate on a project."
—Ludevic, letter to Geralf

name: Seahunter
text: {3}, {T}: Search your library for a Merfolk permanent card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: "They can't feel pain. They just wiggle 'cause they're scared."

name: Sea Kings' Blessing
text: Any number of target creatures become blue until end of turn.

name: Sealed Fate
text: Look at the top X cards of target opponent's library. Exile one of those cards and put the rest back on top of that player's library in any order.

editions.flavor: It's good to know more about your enemy's fate than your enemy does.

name: Sealock Monster
text:
Sealock Monster can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
{5}{U}{U}: Monstrosity 3. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put three +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)
When Sealock Monster becomes monstrous, target land becomes an Island in addition to its other types.

name: Seal of Cleansing
text: Sacrifice Seal of Cleansing: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

editions.flavor:
"I am the purifier, the light that clears all shadows."
—Seal inscription

"I am the purifier, the light that clears all shadows."
—Seal inscription

"Find the dens of evil and flood them with light."
—Hulo, the Penitent Wanderer

"I am the purifier, the light that clears all shadows."
—Seal inscription
"I am the purifier, the light that clears all shadows."—Seal inscription

name: Seal of Doom
text: Sacrifice Seal of Doom: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

editions.flavor:
"A basilisk's gaze is effective, but disposing of physical remains is a tiresome task. It's far more discrete to dissolve one's victim entirely."
—Szadek

"I am the banisher, the ill will that snuffs the final candle."
—Seal inscription
"A basilisk's gaze is effective, but disposing of physical remains is a tiresome task. It's far more discreet to dissolve one's victim entirely."—Szadek

name: Seal of Fire
text: Sacrifice Seal of Fire: Seal of Fire deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Jace vs. Chandra
editions.flavor: After the fourth time Chandra left a place engulfed in flames, she decided to just go ahead and make it her thing.

"If it breathes, it will burn."
—Rakdos pyromancers' creed
After the fourth time Chandra left a place engulfed in flames, she decided to just go ahead and make it her thing.

"I am the romancer, the passion that consumes the flesh."
—Seal inscription

name: Seal of Primordium
text: Sacrifice Seal of Primordium: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

editions.flavor:
"I am the simplifier, the root that drags all artifice to earth."
—Seal inscription

name: Seal of Removal
text: Sacrifice Seal of Removal: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor:
"I am the unraveler, the loosened thread that will not hold."
—Seal inscription

name: Seal of Strength
text: Sacrifice Seal of Strength: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: When does majestic become ominous?

"I am the feeder, the morsel that revives the starving."
—Seal inscription

name: Seal of the Guildpact
text:
As Seal of the Guildpact enters the battlefield, choose two colors.
Each spell you cast costs {1} less to cast for each of the chosen colors it is.

editions.flavor: "I'd rather see the guilds contend together with words in the halls of power, than in the streets with swords."—Jace Beleren

name: Sea Monster
text: Sea Monster can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

editions.flavor: It's easy to believe the monster is a myth—until you feel three hundred thousand pounds of myth crashing down on your ship.
Water is life. Or perhaps it is just something to wash it down with.
Water is life. Or perhaps it is just something to wash it down with.
Water is life. Or perhaps it is just something to wash it down with.
"Abandon ship!"
It's easy to believe the monster is a myth—until you feel three hundred thousand pounds of myth crashing down on your ship.

name: Séance
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, you may exile target creature card from your graveyard. If you do, put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of that card except it's a Spirit in addition to its other types. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.

name: Sea of Sand
text:
Players reveal each card they draw.
Whenever a player draws a land card, that player gains 3 life.
Whenever a player draws a nonland card, that player loses 3 life.
Whenever you roll {CHAOS}, put target permanent on top of its owner's library.

name: Search for Survivors
text: Reorder your graveyard at random. An opponent chooses a card at random in your graveyard. If it's a creature card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, exile it.

editions.flavor: There's no rest for a Keldon.

name: Search for Tomorrow
text:
Search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
Suspend 2—{G} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {G} and exile it with two time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.)

name: Searchlight Geist
text:
Flying
{3}{B}: Searchlight Geist gains deathtouch until end of turn. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

editions.flavor: It rises with the fall of darkness, seeking souls to extinguish.

name: Search the City
text:
When Search the City enters the battlefield, exile the top five cards of your library.
Whenever you play a card with the same name as one of the exiled cards, you may put one of those cards with that name into its owner's hand. Then if there are no cards exiled with Search the City, sacrifice it. If you do, take an extra turn after this one.

name: Search Warrant
text: Target player reveals his or her hand. You gain life equal to the number of cards in that player's hand.

editions.flavor: "And would you care to explain why your satchel is radiating an aura of unstable energy?"

name: Searing Blaze
text:
Searing Blaze deals 1 damage to target player and 1 damage to target creature that player controls.
Landfall — If you had a land enter the battlefield under your control this turn, Searing Blaze deals 3 damage to that player and 3 damage to that creature instead.

name: Searing Blood
text: Searing Blood deals 2 damage to target creature. When that creature dies this turn, Searing Blood deals 3 damage to the creature's controller.

editions.flavor: Purphoros's blessing: sometimes a boon, sometimes a bane. Always ablaze.

name: Searing Flesh
text: Searing Flesh deals 7 damage to target opponent.

editions.flavor: Zemoo found out the hard way that "inflammable" and "flammable" mean the same thing.

name: Searing Light
text: Destroy target attacking or blocking creature with power 2 or less.

editions.flavor:
"Light can lay bare our fears. It can also make them go away."
—Nazra of the Stone Havens

name: Searing Meditation
text: Whenever you gain life, you may pay {2}. If you do, Searing Meditation deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor:
"When I meditate I see the world as it should be. All that does not fit, I remove."
—Alovnek, Boros guildmage

editions.set: Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
editions.flavor:
"When I meditate I see the world as it should be. All that does not fit, I remove."
—Alovnek, Boros guildmage

name: Searing Rays
text: Choose a color. Searing Rays deals damage to each player equal to the number of creatures of that color that player controls.

editions.flavor:
"This is a battle of pawns, for the highest stakes imaginable."
—Urza

name: Searing Spear
text: Searing Spear deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: Sometimes you die a glorious death with your sword held high. Sometimes you're just target practice.
Sometimes you die a glorious death with your sword held high. Sometimes you're just target practice.

name: Searing Spear Askari
text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{1}{R}: Searing Spear Askari gains menace until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)

editions.flavor: When the other soldiers of Zhalfir fall, the askaris will yet stand.

name: Searing Touch
text:
Buyback {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Searing Touch deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

name: Searing Wind

text: Whenever Seascape Aerialist or another Ally enters the battlefield under your control, you may have Ally creatures you control gain flying until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "The sky is like another sea. It teems with currents, life, and endless possibility."

text:

Enchanted land is an Island.

editions.flavor:

"My vengeance will drown my enemies as my storms drown the desert."

text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.

name: Seashell Cameo
text: {T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:
"Today a seashell fell from the empty sky here in Kinymu, a hundred leagues from the sea. I'm torn—shall I carve a woman or a bird?"
—Isel, master carver

name: Seaside Citadel
text:
